image.altText: A boy holds a sign reading stop the bashing swearing and killing

props.synopsis: Aboriginal men have led a march through Alice Springs calling for an end to domestic violence, following a landmark inquest examining the issue.

title.children: 'Not a women's issue': Alice Springs Aboriginal men lead anti-DV march

image.altText: a rocket launches in the outback

props.synopsis: The Arnhem Space Centre will cease operations effective immediately, the company behind it says, while unveiling plans to move the facility to Cape York in Queensland.

title.children: NT space base that launched NASA rockets to cease operations

image.altText: A rainbow in a full arch reaches over the red soil horizon line. Huge storm clouds are in the background. It's wet.

props.synopsis: Swimmers are splashing in the Todd River and graziers are being flooded in as the southern NT welcomes a wet start to summer.

title.children: Outback rivers flowing as 'beautiful' rain 'hammers down' on Red Centre

image.altText: A young First Nations woman in a radio studio with an ABC mic in front of her and headset on. White shirt smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Thirty-eight young people have been named 2025 ABC Heywire winners for their resilience, courage and desire to create change. Here's where you can find their stories.

title.children: Heywire winners reveal 'brave and authentic' stories of regional Australia

image.altText: A drone photo of a coastline with blue ocean, yellow sand and lush green.

props.synopsis: A multi-agency border operation has been launched in the Northern Territory to target a rise in illegal fishing and people smuggling through Arnhem Land waters.

title.children: Border Force to target foreign boat arrivals in northern Australia

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman looking serious.

props.synopsis: The family of an Indigenous woman killed in a hit-and-run in Darwin have spoken out after the man who struck her and tried to cover it up, leaving her disembodied leg on the highway, was released from prison on appeal.

title.children: Hit-run victim's family 'disgusted' after killer released from prison

image.altText: A woman in a yellow jacket and sunglasses

props.synopsis: The chief executive of the Northern Territory's biggest legal aid provider has rejected a $1.5 million offer from the agency to settle a long-running Federal Court case.

title.children: NAAJA CEO seeking upward of $1.5m in damages after unlawful sacking

image.altText: A man wearing dark-rimmed glasses and a police uniform speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: NT Police Assistant Commissioner Michael White said this was a "very significant event" that has caused "significant shock to the community".

title.children: Man, 22, charged over alleged rape of woman in Alice Springs

image.altText: A Rex plane on a runway.

props.synopsis: The corporate regulator ASIC is suing Rex Airlines, alleging the company and four of its directors engaged in "deceptive and misleading conduct" over its profitability.

title.children: ASIC sues Rex Airlines, alleging company misled market on profitability

image.altText: A boy goes to give an excited Albanese a high five in a classroom

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will pledge to replace a test that ties access to subsidised childcare to the number of hours parents work each fortnight.

title.children: PM pledges three subsidised childcare days if families earn under $530k

image.altText: An illustration of three women looking towards the camera.

props.synopsis: For generations words like fat, obese and overweight have been thrown around like hand grenades. In medical settings, the damage dealt can last generations. And the victims are overwhelmingly female.

title.children: The hidden impact of fat shaming in Australia's medical system

image.altText: A man vaping tilts his head upwards as a plume of smoke rises from his mouth and nose.

props.synopsis: Pharmacy chain Chemist Warehouse and big tobacco have become unlikely rivals, in a battle to gain market share among Australia's nicotine-addicted smokers and vapers.

title.children: 'It's a con': Prescribed vapes set to cost taxpayers millions

image.altText: RBA governor Michele Bullock speaks to reporters at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank board teases borrowers by extending hopes of a February rate cut, but will it arrive?

title.children: The RBA should remain 'alert' to a 'sudden unravelling' of jobs market

image.altText: plane sunset generic thumbnail

props.synopsis: As Australians gear up for the holiday season, new research reveals the growing environmental cost of global tourism.

title.children: Desire for travel driving a surge in emissions, researchers say

image.altText: A collection of scrolled parchments.

props.synopsis: As counter-terrorism police investigate the torching of a Melbourne synagogue on Friday, its community is fighting to save priceless Torah scrolls damaged in the arson attack.

title.children: Each scroll damaged in Melbourne's synagogue blaze 'has its own story'

image.altText: Helicopter landed on a beach with people nearby.

props.synopsis: From the air it must have looked a great spot to land, a big stretch of white sand and miles from anywhere. Little did this "helicopter safari" group know, one of Tasmania's most vocal opponents to helicopters in wilderness areas was watching on.

title.children: Row over 'unauthorised' landing of 16 helicopters on beach revealed

image.altText: A hand holds the Essure contraceptive device

props.synopsis: Despite a Victorian judge rejecting claims that a female contraceptive device caused them major health problems, women engaged in a class action have vowed to keep fighting.

title.children: Women disappointed by Essure class action judgement vow to fight on

image.altText: Illuminated purple and white Telstra Shop signage outside Brisbane CBD store.

props.synopsis: An investigation found the telecommunications company made 473 breaches during a disruption in March, with Telstra's Triple Zero call centre failing to properly transfer calls to emergency services.

title.children: Telstra slapped with $3 million fine for triple-0 network outage

image.altText: Australian twenty dollar bills

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar fell by more than 1 per cent following the RBA's meeting and the governor's press conference yesterday, with the ASX expected to ease modestly. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar 'crunched' by RBA, ASX set to ease

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASIC sues REX airlines and four directors
Australian dollar smashed by RBA's 'dovish' pivot

image.altText: Charli XCX with messy hair wearing a white shirt and looking at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: In a blockbuster year for music releases, nothing excited us more than these 50 albums.

title.children: Fifty incredible 2024 albums that weren't released by Taylor Swift

image.altText: man wearing suit with press pack behind them

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu is set to give testimony for the first time after being charged with bribery, fraud and breach of public trust in three separate cases.

title.children: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu fronts corruption trial

image.altText: A man withdraws cash from an ATM in Singapore

props.synopsis: Singaporean scam victims could lose access to their own money as the country ramps up efforts to curb hundreds of millions of dollars lost to scams.

title.children: Singapore's radical solution to global scam epidemic

image.altText: Aerial photograph of a rose garden planted in the shape of an Arabian horse.

props.synopsis: When a Facebook group of nearly 2 million Google Earth enthusiasts homed in on a satellite image of an odd garden in northern Tasmania, its creator responded.

title.children: 'Thanks for noticing': Secret garden spotted on Google Earth 25 years after being built

image.altText: Exterior of Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: The Australian Human Rights Commission says it is "very concerned" that female detainees are being held in compounds next to men separated due to the nature of their offending, including sexual offences.

title.children: Female detainees 'experience abuse' through fence with sex offenders in Sydney

image.altText: A police officer carrying a woman from a building following an airstrike.

props.synopsis: The comments come after Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy told incoming US President Donald Trump he would be open to talks, but was sceptical Vladimir Putin would want peace.

title.children: Ukraine hit by strikes as ally hints peace talks possible within months

image.altText: field hugged by colleagues on parliament's first sitting day

props.synopsis: Queensland Parliament has begun debating the youth justice law bill, which features the LNP's "adult crime, adult time" policy.

title.children: Debate starts to sentence young offenders as adults for serious crime

image.altText: A woman makes a love heart with her hands and smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Sasha Skochilenko's decision to speak out about Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine landed her a seven-year prison sentence. While she was behind bars, support arrived in her cell from an unexpected source — Australia.

title.children: Woman jailed after 'discrediting' Russia's army gets unexpected support

image.altText: A 1920s black and white photo of a well-dressed woman on a couch.

props.synopsis: In a time when few Australian women travelled or lived overseas, this group ventured into the unknown.

title.children: A century ago, these Australian women 'pursued adventure' in America

image.altText: A woman holds a thermal camera, pointing it at a construction site and reading the screen.

props.synopsis: CoreLogic data shows the 6.27 million homes built pre-2010 have a median 2.8-star energy rating, while the 1.5 million built post-2010 have a median 5.9 rating.

title.children: Homes built after 2010 'twice as energy-efficient as older homes'

image.altText: woman stands with mobile phone near christmas tree

props.synopsis: Kara is childless not by choice, and says with most of her friends having entered parenthood, celebrations and holidays like Christmas are some of the hardest times for her.

title.children: 'A feeling of being forgotten': Christmas when you're childless not by choice

image.altText: Luigi Mangione holds a McDonald's Happy Meal box up next to his face while sitting in a car.

props.synopsis: The 26-year-old Maryland man was arrested with a gun believed to be the one used in the killing and writings suggesting his anger with corporate America.

title.children: What we know about Luigi Mangione, the accused CEO killer

image.altText: Victoria Bitter

props.synopsis: The National Film and Sound Archive's 10 new additions to the Sounds of Australia registry include Chains by Tina Arena, the original Doctor Who theme, and an iconic ad for Victoria Bitter beer.

title.children: 'A hard-earned thirst needs a big cold beer': Victoria Bitter ad among new Sounds of Australia

image.altText: red tomatoes at the supermarket

props.synopsis: The price of truss tomatoes across Australia is expected to stay down in the lead up to Christmas. That might be good thing for shoppers, but some growers say they're struggling to break even.

title.children: 'There is certainly a glut': Truss tomato growers call for shoppers to help combat oversupply

image.altText: Arthur Jones looking closely at his medals.

props.synopsis: World War II veteran Arthur Jones is presented with his service medals for the first time, as he celebrates his 100th birthday with family, attributing his longevity to having a "good wife".

title.children: WWII veteran receives overdue medals while celebrating 100th birthday

image.altText: A landscape shot with a yellow cloud busting

props.synopsis: The WA government wants to "modernise" the state's 85-million-hectare pastoral estate, but pastoralists say changes will be difficult and expensive to honour.

title.children: Graziers fear WA pastoral lease changes could push families off land
